abstract.text: Allows only one element to pass through during each specified interval, emitting either the first or the latest element seen in that period.
This operator enables sharing and caching of results from an async sequence
based on a specified caching strategy and ten hashable cache keys.
The combined hashable keys uniquely identify the shared sequence in the cache.
Retries the upstream
using the provided retry strategy.
Retries the upstream
up to a specified number of times.
Returns an async sequence that contains, in order, the elements of the base sequence specified by the range.
This operator enables sharing and caching of results from an async sequence
based on a specified caching strategy and five hashable cache keys.
The combined hashable keys uniquely identify the shared sequence in the cache.
This operator enables sharing and caching of results from an async sequence
based on a specified caching strategy and three hashable cache keys.
The combined hashable keys uniquely identify the shared sequence in the cache.
Tries to catch a specific type of error emitted by the upstream
and handles them using the provided throwing closure.
Introduces a breakpoint into the async sequence when an error occurs.
Returns a type-erased async sequence.
An async sequence that raises a fatal error if its upstream sequence throws.
Returns a sequence containing a specific indexed element.
If the sequence finishes normally or with an error before emitting the specified element, then the sequence doesn’t produce any elements.
Transforms all elements, errors, and completion of the sequence into
values.
This operator enables sharing and caching of results from an async sequence
based on a specified caching strategy and a single hashable cache key.
The hashable key uniquely identifies the shared sequence in the cache.
Starts processing the elements of this async sequence, handling output and completion events,
and returns an
token that can be used to cancel the subscription.
Retries the upstream
with a custom strategy when the error is castable to a specific type.
This operator enables sharing and caching of results from an async sequence
based on a specified caching strategy and two hashable cache keys.
The combined hashable keys uniquely identify the shared sequence in the cache.
Retries the upstream
up to a specified number of times only when a specific error type is encountered.
Catches any errors emitted by the upstream
and handles them using the provided closure.
Replaces any
values from the sequence with the provided non-nil value.
Accumulates state over the elements of an asynchronous sequence, emitting each intermediate accumulated value.
Returns the first element of the sequence, or
if the sequence is empty.
Replaces any error from the sequence with the provided value.
Decodes the output from the upstream using a specified decoder.
This operator enables sharing and caching of results from an async sequence
based on a specified caching strategy and four hashable cache keys.
The combined hashable keys uniquely identify the shared sequence in the cache.
Encodes the output from upstream using the specified encoder.
Delays delivery of all output by the specified amount of time, using a default clock.
This operator enables sharing and caching of results from an async sequence
based on a specified caching strategy and the context in which it is called
(file, function, line, column). The cache keys uniquely identify the shared sequence
in the cache using these call-site identifiers.
Tries to catch any errors emitted by the upstream
and handles them using the provided throwing closure.
Transforms any error produced by the sequence using the provided closure.
Merges the results of mapping each element to an
, with control over subscription demand.
Returns a sequence that multicasts elements to multiple concurrent consumers.
A namespace for grouping related AsyncSequence operations.
This operator enables sharing and caching of results from an async sequence
based on a specified caching strategy and eight hashable cache keys.
The combined hashable keys uniquely identify the shared sequence in the cache.
Returns a sequence that multicasts elements to multiple concurrent consumers.
This operator enables sharing and caching of results from an async sequence
based on a specified caching strategy and nine hashable cache keys.
The combined hashable keys uniquely identify the shared sequence in the cache.
Introduces a conditional breakpoint into the async sequence.
Transforms each output value from the upstream sequence into
Transforms a specific error value produced by the sequence using the provided closure.
Retries the upstream
up to a specified number of times only when a specific error occurs.
Retries the upstream
up to a specified number of times.
Catches a specific type of error emitted by the upstream
and handles them using the provided closure.
Raises a fatal error if the upstream async sequence throws (other than cancellation), otherwise republishes all received values.
Transforms a sequence of
values back into a sequence of their original elements, rethrowing errors.
Collects all received elements and emits a single array when the upstream sequence finishes.
Groups the elements of the sequence into substreams based on a key.
Retries the upstream
with a custom retry strategy only on a specific error.
Retries the upstream
up to a specified number of times only when an error can be cast to a specific type.
Logs events from the sequence to the console, optionally with a prefix.
Delays delivery of all output by the specified amount of time, using the provided clock.
This operator enables sharing and caching of results from an async sequence
based on a specified caching strategy and six hashable cache keys.
The combined hashable keys uniquely identify the shared sequence in the cache.
Adds side-effects to the lifetime events of the sequence.
Retries the upstream
up to a specified number of times only when a specific error occurs.
This operator enables sharing and caching of results from an async sequence
based on a specified caching strategy and seven hashable cache keys.
The combined hashable keys uniquely identify the shared sequence in the cache.
